author: m.kalinin
content:
That's tricky. The spec doesn't say anything about this ancestor of the head of the canonical chain, it could be more specific by saying that *if an ancestor is `VALID`* (assuming full validation) the update may be skipped.

This would be enough to rely on the invariant that CL never sends an fcU if a beacon block enveloping the head is invalid. Thus CL will either extend the canonical chain or switch a fork by the subsequent fcU calls.

author: m.kalinin
content: I agree with that, I wish the spec were stricter in this particular case. The reason behind the MAY is because we didn't want to enforce any specific EL's behaviour as from the protocol's standpoint either way would be correct
